meanings.sent1: After the storm, we need to replant the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to replant the crops after the heavy rain destroyed them.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally pulled out the wrong plant, so I had to replant it in the soil.
meanings.sent4: She had to replant her dreams in a new field of opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully replanted the seedlings to ensure they would grow strong.

meanings.definition: To plant (something) again in a different location.
meanings.sent1: We had to replant the tree from the backyard to the front yard.
meanings.sent2: The landscaper suggested we replant the shrubs to create a better design.
meanings.sent3: I had to replant the flower pot after my cat knocked it over.
meanings.sent4: She decided to replant her business in a more bustling neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to replant the apple trees in a sunnier spot for better growth.
